oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Deficiency, commensurators and 4-dimensional infrasolvmanifolds
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hillman, J. A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Group Theory
Mathematics - Geometric Topology
20F99
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We show that if $\pi$ is the fundamental group of a 4-dimensional infrasolvmanifold then $-2\leq{def(\pi)}\leq0$, and give examples realizing each of these values. We also determine the abstract commensurators of such groups. Finally we show that if $G$ is a finitely generated group the kernel of the natural homomorphism from $G$ to its abstract commensurator $Comm(G)$ is locally nilpotent by locally finite, and is finite if $\mathrm{def}(G)>1$.
Comment: Introduction and \S3.6 expanded; minor corrections. Estimates for torsion-free nilpotent groups (\S3.6) added in v3
